com.dautelle.realtime
Class LocalContext

java.lang.Object
  com.dautelle.realtime.Context
      com.dautelle.realtime.LocalContext
public final class LocalContext
extends Context

This class represents a local context; it is used to define inheritable environment settings.

The settings (LocalContext.Variable) are thread-local and inherited by the concurrent threads executed while in the scope of the LocalContext (see ConcurrentContext). For example:

     LocalContext.enter(); // Enters local context scope.
     try {
         MY_VAR.setValue(myValue); // Environment setting for the current
         ...                       // thread and concurrent thread spawned
                                   // from this local context scope.
     } finally {
         LocalContext.exit(); // End of local context scope.
     }
     static final LocalContext.Variable MY_VAR = new LocalContext.Variable();

Settings outside of a LocalContext scope, affects all threads (global setting}. For example:

     public static final LocalContext.Variable DEBUG = new LocalContext.Variable();
     public static void main(String[] args) {
          DEBUG.setValue(new Boolean(true)); // Affects all threads.
          ...
     }
